answers.answer: Only the Eye MD can tell you for sure about the nevus. However if he/she was seriously concerned they would likely you see an retina MD for a OCT and other tests immediately.Other things that need to be excluded: smoking, obesity, diabetes, high blood pressure. Some times you are perfectly healthy but the blood vessels look "tortuous" I just got finishing working up a neighbor with this problem and everything is perfect. Its just the way they look. Keeping tabs on them and a healthy lifestyle is likely enoughJC HDML

question: Had an eye exam and my vision is great but MD says I have cholesterol deposits in eyes that he does not see in a 45 year old woman and a choroidal nevus that is flat in right eye.  I know I will go back in 4-6 months to recheck the nevus...but generally should not worry about it, correct?  However, the cholesterol deposits...I had a lipid panel done 2 weeks prior, fasting....and my panel was pretty good...LDL 113 (I know I can get it down under 100), HDL 49, triglycerides 70, and total cholesterol 180...my goal is 150.  If I have never had a problem with high cholesterol...how do I explain the deposits...it makes me nervous.
title: choroidal nevus
